titleStmt.title: The Goddess Envy to Doctor Delany

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l:
────────Fragili quærens illidere dentem
Offendet solido────────
Printed in the year 1730.
From the same Vol. of Pamphlets. \i.e. Dt P.23.10, i.e. P.pp.10(18)=G205\

I know not the Authors of these two Pieces\S175 and Z690\: but they are connected with Pieces of Swift & Delany already published (& nearly at these times) in Swift's Works: & I have not met with them in any Edition of Swift's works.
Admire not Sir, that I so long unseen,
Have but in Secret thy Attendant been
That tortur'd long, I never dared till now,
My hate of thee before the World avow.
Still had I hid my fury in my Breast,
Would my relentless Snakes but let me rest;
For long I've learned my Lot ordained by fate,
To raise those Names most high whom most I hate.
But oh! In vain I strove, the eating flame
Would out, thô well I knew it sealed thy fame.
You may rejoice your Glory is secure,
And it must now with time itself endure.
Famed Homer, Maro, Dryden had from me
No greater Favours than I've shown to thee.
No greater Rage against them I displayed,
No greater Folly in that Rage betrayed.
Nor then, tho dire I seem to weaker Eyes
of Man, the Glory of my hate despise.
Not all the countless praises you have gained
From Crouds of Youth by thee to Virtue trained
By thee with every nobler Science graced,
Distinguished for their Elegance of Taste:
Not all the Crouds that round thy Pulpit throng,
Rapt with the force of thy persuasive Tongue,
Not all the wretched by thy Bounty eased,
Nor modest merit by thy Friendship raised,
Not all you e'er can do or preach or write,
Exalts your Glory equal to my Spite.
The Orator's harangue, the Poet's Lays,
Tho tuning all their Notes to Virtue's Praise,
The breathing Marble and th' expressive Coin,
Tho' History with them her Labours join;
All these united can't true worth declare,
Since oft th' Effects of Flattery or Fear;
True Worth is best determined by my hate;
That cannot be suspected of Deceit.
